item.title: Bev add a quote by Anatole Broyard
item.description: "Two people making love, she once said, are like one drowned person resuscitating the other." -- Anatole Broyard

item.title: Bev add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "A lie is more comfortable than doubt, more useful than love, more lasting than truth." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Bev add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Shame on the man who goes to his grave escorted by the miserable hopes that have kept him alive." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Bev add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Bev add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "They say of me, and so they should, It's doubtful if I come to good. I see acquaintances and friends Accumulating dividends And making enviable names In science, art and parlor games. But I, despite expert advice, Keep doing things I think are nice, And though to good I never come Inseparable my nose and thumb." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bev add a quote by George Santayana
item.description: "There are books in which the footnotes, or the comments scrawled by some reader's hand in the margin, are more interesting than the text. The world is one of those books." -- George Santayana

item.title: Bev add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "There was a reason for the cost of those perfectly plain black dresses." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bev add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Bev add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Bev add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
Bev add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "In the dark times Will there also be singing? Yes, there will also be singing. About the dark times." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Bev add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Sometimes it's more important to be human, than to have good taste. " -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Bev add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Nowadays, anyone who wishes to combat lies and ignorance and to write the truth must overcome at least five difficulties. He must have the courage to write the truth when truth is everywhere opposed; the keenness to recognize it, although it is everywhere concealed; the skill to manipulate it as a weapon; the judgment to select those in whose hands it will be effective; and the running to spread the truth among such persons." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Bev add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "If you retain nothing else, always remember the most important rule of beauty, which is: who cares?" -- Tina Fey
